channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
channel.desc: A year in the life of Bodnant Garden. Troy Scott Smith plans a winter garden to attract visitors. A 300-year-old oak tree is dying and a plague of moles wreak havoc.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Canal Boat Diaries
channel.desc: As Robbie makes his way to Ripon in North Yorkshire, he tackles the fast-flowing River Ouse and is forced to make an emergency stop.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Mrs Weaver has moved, and Tom wants to take the oil from her central heating tank. Jerry is trying to discredit a colleague, and Margo is asked to play the lead in a production.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Prime Minister
channel.desc: Jim sees how he can use the health minister's desire to abolish smoking through taxation to stop Treasury opposition to his plans for tax cuts.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: How the Celts Saved Britain
channel.desc: Dan Snow reveals how the Irish saved Britain from cultural oblivion in the Dark Ages. He examines the demise of civilisation in Britain after the Romans left.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Welded Together - Storyville
channel.desc: A Storyville documentary about a young welder, forced to confront a traumatic past when she has to care for her half-sister. A powerful story of love, survival and second chances.[(96057)]
